나의 슬픔을 뭐라 표현할 수가 없네.

en: The cat prefers fish to meat.
Who's that in the car with Tom?
kor: 차 안에 Tom과 같이 있는 사람이 누구야?

en: You've got something in your teeth.
You should write it down before you forget it.
Is there anyone here who speaks French?
kor: 프랑스어 할 줄 아는 사람 여기 있어?

en: You should do that by yourself.
kor: 너는 스스로 그것을 할 필요가 있다.

en: It's not fair to attribute your failure to your parents.
kor: 당신의 실패를 당신의 부모님 탓으로 돌리는것은 옳지 않습니다

en: The cause of the accident is unknown.

kor: 난 널 절대로 용서하지 않을 거야.

en: Is there anything you want us to send you from home?
kor: 우리가 집에서 너에게 보내줬으면 하는 거 없니?

en: Summer is the season I like best.
The cause of the fire is unknown.
She hasn't heard the news yet.
I can't believe Tom is a grandfather.
Can you tell me why Tom is doing that?
kor: 톰이 왜 저러는지 말해 줄 수 있어?

en: I didn't want to get hurt.
I think Tom would be thrilled.
kor: 내 생각에 톰은 아주 신나할 것 같아.

en: I was overseas at the time.
I don't know why you're studying French.
kor: 왜 네가 프랑스어를 공부하고 있는지 모르겠어.

en: I don't really have a favorite song.
kor: 특별히 좋아하는 노래같은 건 딱히 없어.

en: Tom told Mary not to swim there.
kor: 톰은 매리한테 거기서 수영하지 말라고 말했다.

en: He breathed deeply before entering his boss's office.
kor: 그는 상사의 사무실로 들어가기 전에 심호흡을 했다.

en: Who's the most intelligent person you know?
kor: 네가 아는 사람 중에서 누가 가장 똑똑한 사람이야?

en: Mary is the richest woman I know.
kor: 메리는 내가 아는 선에서 가장 부자야.

en: How many hamburgers did you buy?
I wanted to give you a chance.
Walking the dog is my responsibility.
He made his will last year.
Our car is three years older than yours.
kor: 우리 차는 너희 차보다 3년 더 오래됐다.

en: He wants to work in a hospital.
He invited me to the party.
Tom had a good time in Boston.
I knew that Tom was just a freshman, so I was surprised to see him hanging out with seniors.
kor: 난 톰이 그냥 신입생일 뿐이라고만 알았는데, 그러다보니 톰이랑 선배들이 서로 어울려다니는 걸 보고 놀랐어.

en: Tom talks to his mother more often than he talks to his father.
kor: 톰은 아버지보다 어머니와 대화를 더 자주 한다.

en: You might at least say "thank you."
I didn't think you were interested.
That girl is under the delusion that she is a princess.
kor: 저 여자애는 자기가 공주라는 망상에 빠져 있어.

en: I'm not going to go in there.
Tom has been bitten by his horse.
I think that Tom is still angry.
kor: 톰은 아직도 화가 나 있는 것 같아.

en: Tom fainted at the sight of the needle.
Tom isn't making coffee, is he?
I really feel sorry for Tom.
I think that everything's fine now.
I'm so glad that you're here.
I started a new blog. I'll do my best not to be one of those people who blogs a lot right at the start and then quits blogging.
kor: 난 블로그를 시작했어. 블로그를 초반에만 반짝 많이 하다가 관두는 사람처럼은 되지 않으려고 최선을 다할 거야.

en: What's the difference between religion and philosophy?
I really don't want to miss that.
kor: 나는 정말로 그것을 놓치고 싶지 않다.

en: God is always watching over us.
I am left with all the responsibility.
kor: 나는 모든 책임을 안은 채 남겨졌다.

en: Are you really willing to help?

kor: 나는 이 말을 이해할 수가 없다.

en: I used to go to Boston quite frequently.
I think that French is the most beautiful language.
kor: 프랑스어는 가장 아름다운 언어인 것 같아.

en: I think that Tom missed the train.
I managed to crack the code.
This information is very important to us.

kor: 톰은 많은 언어를 할 줄 알아.

en: He did not want her to leave.
This sentence isn't useful for language learners.
kor: 이 문장은 언어 학습자에게 별로 도움이 되지 않는다.

en: This is a battle worth fighting.
Tom pulled out an old shoebox from his closet and opened it.
kor: 톰은 벽장에서 헌 구두상자를 꺼내 열었다.

en: He was at the bottom of the class.
Did you see Mary's reaction when she saw the spider?
kor: 너 마리가 거미 봤을 때의 반응을 봤어?

en: I had the same thing happen to me last month.
Tom was lonely and wished he had someone to talk to.
kor: 톰이 외로워서 누군가 말을 걸 사람이 있었으면 좋겠다고 기도했어.

en: How many years have you been studying judo?
There are a lot of animals in the park.
The water flows under the bridge.
Tom isn't here, I assure you.

kor: 개는 대부분 갈색 눈을 가지고 있어.

en: Under a microscope, some viruses appear quite beautiful.
kor: 현미경 아래에선 몇몇 바이러스는 꽤 아름다워 보여.

en: Tom is trying to avoid drinks with sugar.
We're having a barbeque on Sunday.
Do you want me to sing?
The cause of the fire is yet unknown.
I'd be happy to teach you French.
Tom is a very frugal person.
Tom found out what went wrong.
I want Tom to go to Australia to visit his uncle.
kor: 난 톰이 삼촌네에 방문하러 호주에 갔으면 좋겠어.

en: I told Tom not to use those.
kor: 난 톰한테 그걸 쓰지 말라고 했는데.

en: Are you saying that you don't know how to do this?
kor: 이걸 어떻게 하는지 모른다고 말하는 거야?

en: I know what Tom needs to do.
kor: 나는 톰이 무엇을 할 필요가 있는지 알고 있다.

en: I could barely open my eyes.
kor: 난 눈을 거의 뜰 수 없었어.

en: I was afraid I might be late.
Tom didn't study for his final exam.
Living abroad is the best way to learn a foreign language.
kor: 해외에서 사는 것은 외국어를 배우기에 최선의 방법이다.

en: Do you want to do that?
The next concert will take place in October.

kor: 난 빠른 걸음은 할 수 없어.

en: Tom is trying to figure things out.
Tom will have a hard time.
kor: 톰은 힘든 시간을 보내게 될 거야.

en: He translated a Japanese novel into French.
I have nowhere to sleep tonight.
kor: 난 오늘밤 잘 곳이 아무데도 없어.

en: Tom is probably going to be there.
Tom was afraid to be here.
He's studying French and web design.
Tom said he wanted to hire someone with experience.
kor: 톰은 경험이 있는 사람을 고용하고 싶다고 말했다.

en: There is no bus service after nine-thirty.
I know Tom is a terrible father.
kor: 톰이 막장 아빠라는 것은 알고 있어.

en: Give him the message when he comes back.
I thought that I heard gunshots.
I have a hard time remembering things.
Why do you walk when you have a car?
We've wasted a lot of time.
He deposited the prize money in the bank.
I wanted to make some telephone calls.
You had bacon and eggs for breakfast, didn't you?
Is there anything you want to tell me?
The world is a dangerous place.
Do you still suffer from headaches?
I might have a chance to do that soon.
kor: 곧 그걸 해볼 기회가 있을지도 모르겠어.

en: I want to go to Australia with my family.
kor: 나는 가족과 함께 오스트레일리아로 가고 싶다.

en: It'll become much warmer in March.
Silver is worth less than gold.
The horse stopped and refused to move.
kor: 말은 멈추고 나서 움직이는 걸 거부했어.

en: Did you see the eclipse yesterday?
Tom bought this horse at an auction.
In the alphabet, B comes after A.
What in the world is this?
Tom has more money than me.
I think I can beat Tom's record.
kor: 내가 톰의 기록을 깰 수 있을 것 같다.

en: Tom says that he won't wait any longer.
kor: 톰은 더 이상 기다리고 싶지 않다고 말했다.

en: Tom said he didn't learn anything at school today.
kor: 톰은 자기가 오늘 학교에서 아무것도 배우지 않았다고 했어.

en: Most people expected Tom to win.
kor: 대부분 사람들이 톰이 이길 거라고 봤다.

en: Please feel free to help yourself to anything in the fridge.
kor: 냉장고에 있는 거 아무거나 편하게 마음껏 드세요.

en: Tom didn't let me answer Mary's question.
kor: 탐은 매리의 질문에 답하지 못하게 했어

en: You need to drink more water.
kor: 너 물 좀 더 마셔야 겠어.

en: Is it that important to you?
I think Mary is way cuter than Alice.
kor: 메리가 앨리스보다 훨씬 더 귀여운 것 같아.

en: Could you loan me some money until payday?
kor: 월급날까지 나한테 돈 좀 빌려줄 수 있어?

en: What color is your new car?
I think what Tom is doing is amazing.
kor: 나는 탐이 하고 있는 일이놀랍다고 생각한다.

en: I live in a small apartment.
Do as I say, not as I do.
kor: 내가 말하는 대로 해, 내가 하는 대로 말고.

en: I should never have come to Australia.
kor: 나는 절대 오스트레일리아에 오지 말았어야 했다.
톰은 심각한 부상을 당할 수도 있었다.

en: Tom doesn't have to go to Australia next week.
kor: 톰은 다음 주 호주에 가지 않아도 돼.

en: Are you saying you don't know how to do this?
kor: 이걸 어떻게 하는지 모른다고 말하는 거야?

en: If you study hard, you'll pass the exam.
kor: 공부를 열심히 하면 시험에 통과할 거야.

en: He asked us to help him.
Why does everybody think Tom and I are stupid?
kor: 왜 다들 나랑 톰이 멍청하다고 생각해?

en: Help yourself to anything you'd like to eat.
Tom thinks that Mary won't need to do that.
kor: 톰은 메리가 그럴 필요가 없다고 생각한다.

en: A good idea occurred to him.
I have some strawberries. Do you want some?
By the way, have you done your homework?
I'll follow you wherever you go.
Asperger syndrome is a form of autism.

kor: 이 일을 하기에는 너무 고급 인력인데.

en: Tom said Boston is a nice place to visit.
kor: 톰은 보스턴이 가보기 좋은 곳이라고 했다.

en: Do you want me to help you?
I was pretty young back in those days.
I don't think Tom is able to do that.
kor: 난 톰이 저런걸 할 수 있으리라고 생각하지 않아.

en: It's not fair to keep Tom in the dark.
kor: 톰을 아무것도 모르도록 두는 건 공정하지 않아.

en: Tom works for a tech company.
You're trying to confuse me, aren't you?
kor: 넌 날 혼란스럽게 하려고 하는 거지?

en: I never should've borrowed money from Tom.
kor: 난 톰한테 돈을 절대 빌리지 말았어야 했는데.

en: Could someone let the dog out?
All of the children had gone to bed before it got dark.
kor: 아이들 모두 어두워지기 전에 침대에 갔었어.

en: I wonder whether Tom left early.
Let's eat, drink, and be merry.
You think you're awake, but you may, in fact, be dreaming.
kor: 넌 네가 깨어있는 줄 알지만, 사실은 꿈꾸고 있을 수도 있어.

en: I cut up all but one of my credit cards.
kor: 나는 내 신용카드를 하나만 빼고 모두 해지했다.

en: Where can I make a phone call?
How long would it take you to paint my garage?
kor: 네가 내 차고를 페인트 해주는데 얼마나 걸릴 것 같아?

en: Eating out is something that I don't do very often.
kor: 외식은 내가 그렇게 자주 하는 것이 아니다.

en: When was the last time you went canoeing?
kor: 가장 최근에 카누를 탄 적이 언제야?

en: Let's meet in front of the theater.
Tom is in the same boat.
Tom said that what you told me wasn't true.
kor: 톰은 네가 나에게 말한것은 사실이 아니라고 말했다.

en: Do you think we could do that?
kor: 우리가 그걸 할 수 있다 생각해?

en: Tom has been trying to help Mary.
I assured Tom that I wouldn't do that.
kor: 난 톰한테 내가 안 그럴 거라고 단언했어.

en: Can you come to the meeting tomorrow afternoon?
kor: 내일 오후 미팅에 오실 수 있으세요?

en: That music gets on his nerves.
Tom doesn't like to speak French.
It might be good if you bought it.
How can anyone trust anything Tom says? He's a pathological liar.
kor: 어떻게 누군가가 톰이 말하는 것을 믿을 수 있지? 그는 병적인 거짓말쟁이야.

en: The earth is far bigger than the moon.
Haven't I met you somewhere before?
kor: 내가 널 어디선가 본 적 있지 않았어?

en: Many people were very angry about that.
kor: 그 일에 대해 많은 사람들이 몹시 화를 냈다.

en: It's been a very long day.
The Mississippi is the longest river in the United States.
